intro: Centropogon monagensis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pittosporum, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Pittosporaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and lowland forest environments. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a vulnerable species.
